ERROR_DIALOG.TITLE: The error details
ERROR_DIALOG.RECOMMENDATION_NETWORK: Ensure you have stable network connection and try again
ERROR_DIALOG.PROBLEM_AUTHENTICATION: You are not authenticated. Your authorization probably expired
ERROR_DIALOG.RECOMMENDATION_AUTHENTICATION: Try to re-login (on this or another browser tab) and repeat the attempt
ERROR_DIALOG.PROBLEM_AUTHORIZATION: You are not authorized to perform this action
ERROR_DIALOG.RECOMMENDATION_AUTHORIZATION: Ask the supervisor to grant you additional rights
ERROR_DIALOG.PROBLEM_YAXYS: Something is wrong with the Yaxys or it's configuration
ERROR_DIALOG.RECOMMENDATION_YAXYS: Report the situation to your system administrator

PROFILE_INTRO.P1: Here you can grant rights to different actions for all of the operators having this profile. Each right can have be in one of the two states: not modified (default) or allowed.
PROFILE_INTRO.P2: Allowed state means the operator having this profile is authorized to perform the action. Not modified state means that this current profile doesn't care about the action. It doesn't grant this right to the users, but also doesn't deny it. The operator still can have some other profiles attached, and one of them can grant this right.
PROFILE_INTRO.P3: You can't deny some right from the operator profile. By default, all of the rights are already denied (not granted) and you should explicitly grant them from here or from the specific operator. But, you can also control the rights at the page of specific operator. You can grant or deny any right from the operator's page and those rights would have higher priority than those given by profiles.

OPERATOR_INTRO.P1_BEFORE: Here you can grant some specific rights to this operator. Please note, that in general it is not recommended to grant rights directly from operators – instead, think of grouping the operators into
OPERATOR_INTRO.P1_AFTER: and grant all the rights to that profiles.
OPERATOR_INTRO.P2: Each right here can be in one of the three states: not modified (default), allowed and denied.
OPERATOR_INTRO.P3: Allowed and Denied states mean the operator is authorized or denied to perform this action correspondingly. Not modified (default) state means that the right is not granted from here, but still can be granted from one of the Operator profiles assigned to this operator.
